WrittenContract.title: Written Contract
WrittenContract.description: The primary agreement signed by both parties. Essential for contracts involving immovable property or administrative bodies.

NoticeofDefault.title: Notice of Default (Warning Letter)
NoticeofDefault.description: A registered letter or legal notice sent to the defaulting party demanding performance, essential for claiming damages.

PaymentReceipt.title: Payment Receipt / Bank Advice
PaymentReceipt.description: Documentary proof of money transferred (loan disbursement) or payments made (performance).

DeliveryNote.title: Delivery Note (Model 19/22)
DeliveryNote.description: Proof that goods were actually delivered to and received by the buyer.

AdmissionofDebt.title: Admission of Debt
AdmissionofDebt.description: A specific written document where the debtor acknowledges the sum owed.

AuditReport.title: Audit Report
AuditReport.description: A financial report detailing outstanding balances, often required in complex B2B disputes.

TitleDeed.title: Title Deed (Librec/Carta)
TitleDeed.description: The primary certificate of holding rights/ownership for urban houses and land.

SitePlan.title: Site Plan
SitePlan.description: Official technical map showing the coordinates, boundaries, and area of the plot.

LeaseAgreement.title: Lease Agreement
LeaseAgreement.description: Contract between the citizen and the City Administration defining the lease period and rights.

ConstructionPermit.title: Construction Permit
ConstructionPermit.description: Official authorization to build, proving legality of the structure.

TaxLandRentReceipts.title: Tax/Land Rent Receipts
TaxLandRentReceipts.description: Proof of continuous payment of obligations, used to evidence continuous possession.

KebeleConfirmation.title: Kebele Confirmation
KebeleConfirmation.description: Letter from the local administration confirming who lives in/occupies the property.

WitnessAffidavitsNuisance.title: Witness Affidavits (Nuisance)
WitnessAffidavitsNuisance.description: Sworn statements detailing the time, duration, and severity of the disturbance (e.g., noise, smell, vibration).

PhotosVideoEvidence.title: Photos/Video Evidence
PhotosVideoEvidence.description: Visual proof of the nuisance source (e.g., pollution, excessive height of a structure).

PriorAgreementServitude.title: Prior Agreement (Servitude)
PriorAgreementServitude.description: If the servitude was created by contract, the written agreement is required.

PayrollSlip.title: Payroll Slip
PayrollSlip.description: A document detailing an employee's salary.

DismissalLetter.title: Dismissal Letter
DismissalLetter.description: A letter of dismissal from service.

GrievanceSubmission.title: Grievance Submission
GrievanceSubmission.description: A document proving a grievance was submitted.

WarningLetter.title: Warning Letter
WarningLetter.description: A warning letter issued to an employee.

CertificateofMarriage.title: Certificate of Marriage
CertificateofMarriage.description: Official certificate issued by VERA or religious/customary authority proving the existence of the marriage.

BirthCertificate.title: Birth Certificate(s)
BirthCertificate.description: Official birth records for all children involved in the dispute, proving age and parentage.

ProofofIncome.title: Proof of Income
ProofofIncome.description: Pay slips, bank statements, or tax records used to calculate maintenance (alimony) capabilities.

FamilyArbitratorsReport.title: Family Arbitrators' Report
FamilyArbitratorsReport.description: (If applicable) A record of the attempt at reconciliation by family elders/arbitrators, often required before formal litigation.

ListofCommonProperty.title: List of Common Property
ListofCommonProperty.description: An inventory document detailing assets acquired during the marriage (movable and immovable).

PoliceReportDomesticViolence.title: Police Report (Domestic Violence)
PoliceReportDomesticViolence.description: Official record of physical or emotional abuse, used as grounds for immediate dissolution or restraining orders.

SchoolFeeReceipts.title: School Fee Receipts
SchoolFeeReceipts.description: Documentary proof of educational expenses for children, used to quantify maintenance claims.

MedicalBoardCertificate.title: Medical Board Certificate
MedicalBoardCertificate.description: Evidence regarding paternity (DNA) or medical incapacity of a spouse.

CopyofDivorceJudgment.title: Copy of Divorce Judgment
CopyofDivorceJudgment.description: The prior court ruling confirming the marriage is dissolved.

ProofofInheritanceDonation.title: Proof of Inheritance/Donation
ProofofInheritanceDonation.description: Documents proving property was acquired via inheritance or donation.

Pre-maritalOwnershipDocuments.title: Pre-marital Ownership Documents
Pre-maritalOwnershipDocuments.description: Documents proving ownership of property before marriage.

JudgmentofDivorce.title: Judgment of Divorce
JudgmentofDivorce.description: The prior court ruling confirming the marriage is dissolved and allowing the property phase to commence.

PropertyValuationReport.title: Property Valuation Report
PropertyValuationReport.description: (Optional/Later Stage) A report by a certified engineer or auditor estimating the value of the assets.

TitleDeedsLibrec.title: Title Deeds / Librec
TitleDeedsLibrec.description: Official ownership certificates for immovable property (houses, land).

DeathCertificate.title: Death Certificate
DeathCertificate.description: Official certificate from VERA or municipality confirming the date and place of death.

WillTestament.title: Will (Testament)
WillTestament.description: A Public, Holographic, or Oral will documenting the deceased's wishes.

KebeleFamilyID.title: Kebele ID / Family Certificate
KebeleFamilyID.description: Official document proving the relationship between the claimant and the deceased (e.g., listing children).

InventoryofEstate.title: Inventory of Estate
InventoryofEstate.description: A detailed list of assets (houses, cars, bank accounts) left by the deceased.

WitnessAffidavitsSuccession.title: Witness Affidavits (Succession)
WitnessAffidavitsSuccession.description: Sworn statements by individuals (usually 3) confirming who the rightful heirs are.

CertificateofLiquidation.title: Certificate of Liquidation
CertificateofLiquidation.description: Document showing debts have been paid (required before final partition).

CertificateOfRegistrationEIPO.title: Certificate of Registration (EIPO)
CertificateOfRegistrationEIPO.description: Official document proving ownership of a Patent, Trademark, or registered Copyright.

ProductSampleSpecimen.title: Product Sample / Specimen
ProductSampleSpecimen.description: The physical product bearing the trademark or the technical documentation of the invention.

CeaseAndDesistLetter.title: Cease and Desist Letter
CeaseAndDesistLetter.description: Formal notice sent to the infringer demanding they stop the unlawful activity.

MarketSurveyAffidavit.title: Market Survey / Affidavit
MarketSurveyAffidavit.description: Proof demonstrating consumer confusion in the marketplace (for Trademark cases).

CustomsInspectionReport.title: Customs Inspection Report
CustomsInspectionReport.description: Official report confirming the seizure of counterfeit goods at the border.

TechnicalExpertReport.title: Technical Expert Report
TechnicalExpertReport.description: Report comparing the registered patent claims to the alleged infringing product.

IdentityCard.title: Identity Card (Kebele/National ID)
IdentityCard.description: The primary document reflecting the current (incorrect) status information.

BirthMarriageCertificateVERA.title: Birth/Marriage Certificate (VERA)
BirthMarriageCertificateVERA.description: Official civil status document requiring correction.

PublicNoticeOfAbsence.title: Public Notice of Absence
PublicNoticeOfAbsence.description: Proof that the petition for absence was published in a newspaper (Civ. Code Art. 159).

GenealogicalAffidavit.title: Genealogical Affidavit
GenealogicalAffidavit.description: Document proving the relationship to the deceased (required for Heirship Certification).

TaxAssessmentNotice.title: Tax Assessment Notice
TaxAssessmentNotice.description: The official letter from the MoR detailing the tax liability, penalties, and interest.

NoticeOfObjectionInitial.title: Notice of Objection (Initial)
NoticeOfObjectionInitial.description: The formal letter submitted by the taxpayer to the MoR/CC challenging the initial assessment.

AccountingRecords.title: Accounting Records (Ledgers, Invoices)
AccountingRecords.description: Mandatory documentation (especially for Category A) to substantiate gross income and deductions.

ImportExportDeclarationSAD.title: Import/Export Declaration (SAD)
ImportExportDeclarationSAD.description: Official customs document detailing the imported goods, value, and applicable duties.

PaymentReceiptsTaxCustoms.title: Payment Receipts (Tax/Customs)
PaymentReceiptsTaxCustoms.description: Proof of compliance, necessary for clearance or to meet the 50% deposit requirement.

ExternalAuditReport.title: External Audit Report
ExternalAuditReport.description: Report from a certified external auditor contradicting the MoR's findings.

PoliceAccidentReport.title: Police/Traffic Accident Report
PoliceAccidentReport.description: Official documentation by police detailing the time, location, parties, and preliminary findings of a traffic or civil incident.

MedicalExpenseReceipts.title: Medical Expense Receipts and Invoices
MedicalExpenseReceipts.description: Receipts, invoices, and payment confirmations for all medical, hospital, and rehabilitation services.

DoctorAssessment.title: Medical Doctor's Assessment and Certificate
DoctorAssessment.description: A physician's certificate detailing the nature, extent, and duration of the injury, and prognosis for recovery or permanent disability.

LostEarningProof.title: Proof of Lost Earnings (Salary Slips/Tax Docs)
LostEarningProof.description: Documents showing previous income and the period during which the claimant was unable to work due to the injury.

FinalAdminDecision.title: Final Administrative Decision (የመጨረሻ የአስተዳደር ውሳኔ)
FinalAdminDecision.description: The written, final decision issued by the administrative agency, signed by the competent official. This decision must be exhausted before court appeal (Art. 48(1)).

DecisionNotificationProof.title: Proof of Decision Notification Date (ውሳኔው የደረሰበት ማስረጃ)
DecisionNotificationProof.description: Evidence (e.g., date stamp, certified mail receipt) showing the exact date the petitioner was notified of the final administrative decision. Crucial for the 30-day appeal limit (Art. 51(1)).

InternalRemedyExhaustion.title: Proof of Exhaustion of Internal Remedies (የውስጥ ቅሬታ መሟጠጥ ማስረጃ)
InternalRemedyExhaustion.description: Documentation showing the petitioner first raised the complaint to the agency's internal complaint body and received a final decision (Art. 48(2)).

AgencyDirectiveCopy.title: Copy of the Challenged Directive (የሚጠየቀው መመሪያ ቅጂ)
AgencyDirectiveCopy.description: A copy of the specific Directive issued by the Agency that is being challenged for judicial review (Art. 48(1)).

property_petitory_vindication.documentTitle: Statement of Claim for Vindication of Property (Petitory Action)

facets.legalText: The Plaintiff is the legal owner/holder of the immovable property situated at [Location].
The Plaintiff acquired the property through [Sale/Succession/Grant] on [Date].
The Defendant is currently in possession of the property without any legal title or right.
Despite demands, the Defendant refuses to vacate the property.

reliefs.text: Judgment declaring the Plaintiff as the sole legal owner/holder of the property.
Order the Defendant to vacate the property and hand it over to the Plaintiff.
Order the Defendant to pay compensation (fruits/rent) for the period of unlawful occupation.

property_possessory_restoration.documentTitle: Statement of Claim for Restoration of Possession

facets.legalText: The Plaintiff was in peaceful and continuous possession of the property.
The Defendant took possession by force/fraud on [Date].
This claim is filed within two years of the usurpation.

reliefs.text: Order the immediate restoration of possession to the Plaintiff (without prejudice to questions of title).

property_boundary_encroachment.documentTitle: Statement of Claim for Removal of Boundary Encroachment

facets.legalText: The legal boundary between the Plaintiff's and Defendant's plots is defined by the official Site Plan.
The Defendant has constructed a wall/structure that crosses the boundary line by [Meters].

reliefs.text: Order the Defendant to demolish the encroaching structure.
Order the restoration of the boundary markers to their original position.

app_stay_construction.documentTitle: Application for Urgent Order to Suspend Construction
app_stay_construction.jurisdictionText: Art. 154 of the Civil Procedure Code.

facets.legalText: The Respondent is currently engaged in active construction on the disputed land.
If the construction is completed, demolition will be difficult and the Applicant's rights will be permanently prejudiced.
The Applicant has demonstrated a strong prima facie case of ownership.

reliefs.text: Order the immediate suspension of all construction activities on the disputed plot pending final judgment.

app_local_inspection.documentTitle: Application for Order of Local Inspection
app_local_inspection.jurisdictionText: Art. 136 of the Civil Procedure Code.

facets.legalText: The oral testimonies and documents regarding the physical features/boundaries of the land are contradictory.
A just decision cannot be rendered without the Court (or its registrar) physically viewing the site.

reliefs.text: Order a local inspection of the property to verify boundaries/possession.

property_nuisance_cessation.documentTitle: Statement of Claim for Cessation of Abnormal Inconvenience (Nuisance)

facets.legalText: The Defendant's actions involve [Noise/Smell/Vibration] originating from [Source].
The inconvenience caused by the Defendant is abnormal and exceeds the level normally expected of the neighborhood.
The Defendant was formally notified of the inconvenience but failed to take corrective measures.

reliefs.text: Judgment ordering the Defendant to immediately cease the source of the abnormal inconvenience.
Order payment of damages suffered by the Plaintiff prior to the cessation.

property_servitude_right_of_way.documentTitle: Statement of Claim for Establishment of Servitude (Right of Way)

facets.legalText: The Applicant's property has no adequate access to a public road.
There are no other practical or less onerous routes available for access.
The requested right of way across the Respondent's land is the route least detrimental to the Servient Tenement (Respondent).

reliefs.text: Judgment establishing a Servitude of Right of Way across the Respondent's property.
Order the Dominant Tenement to pay fair compensation to the Servient Tenement for the damage caused by the passage.

property_possessory_disturbance.documentTitle: Statement of Claim for Cessation of Disturbance of Possession

facets.legalText: The Plaintiff was in peaceful and continuous possession of the property/right.
The Defendant has performed specific actions that interfere with the Plaintiff's peaceful possession (e.g., removing fences, obstructing access).
This claim is filed within two years of the disturbance.

reliefs.text: Order the Defendant to cease all acts of disturbance.
Order the restoration of the property to the state it was in before the disturbance.

app_servitude_temporary_passage.documentTitle: Application for Temporary Mandatory Order to Grant Passage
app_servitude_temporary_passage.jurisdictionText: Art. 154 of the Civil Procedure Code (Injunction) & Art. 1332 Civil Code (Necessity).

facets.legalText: The Respondent has completely blocked the Applicant's only access to the public road.
The blockade threatens the Applicant's ability to live/operate their business, causing imminent and irreparable financial damage.

reliefs.text: Order the Respondent to grant temporary passage to the Applicant pending the final decision on the main servitude claim.

contract_debt_recovery.documentTitle: Statement of Claim for Recovery of Loan/Debt
contract_debt_recovery.jurisdictionText: Art. 216 et seq. of the Civil Procedure Code & Civil Code Art. 2471.

facets.legalText: On [Date], the Plaintiff and Defendant entered into a written loan agreement.
The Plaintiff disbursed the sum of [Amount] ETB to the Defendant.
The repayment period agreed upon expired on [Date].
Despite the maturity of the debt, the Defendant failed to effect payment.
The Plaintiff served a formal notice of default on [Date].

reliefs.text: Judgment ordering the Defendant to pay the principal sum of [Amount] ETB.
Order payment of legal interest (9%) calculated from the date of default.
Order payment of contractual interest agreed at [Percentage] (max 12%).

contract_specific_performance.documentTitle: Statement of Claim for Specific Performance of Contract
contract_specific_performance.jurisdictionText: Art. 1776 of the Civil Code & Civil Procedure Code.

facets.legalText: A valid contract exists between the parties regarding [Subject Matter].
The Plaintiff has fully performed their obligations under the contract.
The Defendant has failed to perform [Specific Obligation] without lawful cause.
Specific performance is of special interest to the Plaintiff and does not affect the personal liberty of the Defendant.

reliefs.text: Order the Defendant to specifically perform the contract by [Action, e.g., transferring title].
Alternatively, if performance is impossible, order payment of damages.

contract_termination_claim.documentTitle: Statement of Claim for Judicial Cancellation of Contract

facets.legalText: The Defendant's non-performance constitutes a fundamental breach affecting the essence of the contract.
The Plaintiff has already paid [Amount] to the Defendant.

reliefs.text: Judgment declaring the contract cancelled/terminated.
Order the parties to be reinstated to their former position (Restitution).

app_attachment_before_judgment.documentTitle: Application for Attachment of Property Before Judgment
app_attachment_before_judgment.jurisdictionText: Art. 151 & 152 of the Civil Procedure Code.

facets.legalText: The Defendant is about to dispose of their property or remove it from the court's jurisdiction with intent to obstruct the execution of the decree.
The Applicant has a strong prima facie case and is likely to succeed in the main suit.

reliefs.text: Order the attachment of the Defendant's property [Specify Property] pending final judgment.
Alternatively, order the Defendant to furnish security for the amount claimed.

app_judgment_on_admission.jurisdictionText: Art. 242 of the Civil Procedure Code.

facets.legalText: In their Statement of Defense, the Respondent has clearly admitted the existence of the contract and the debt.

reliefs.text: Enter immediate judgment for the Plaintiff on the admitted portion of the claim.

labour_unlawful_termination.documentTitle: Statement of Claim for Unlawful Termination

facets.legalText: Existence of an indefinite period employment contract.
A definite period or probationary contract existed, and the period has concluded, implying conversion to an indefinite contract.

group_2.title: The Act of Termination: Procedural Violations

facets.legalText: Termination was effected without any prior written notice specifying the reasons and date of termination.
The notice period provided was insufficient and less than the legal minimum based on years of service.

group_3.title: The Act of Termination: Substantive Violations (Unlawful Grounds)

facets.legalText: Termination was due to the employee's membership in a trade union or participation in union activities.
Termination was due to the employee's pregnancy or maternity leave status.
Termination was due to the employee giving information or filing a complaint against the employer regarding a breach of law.
Termination was based on discriminatory grounds such as race, color, sex, religion, political opinion, national extraction, or social origin.

group_4.title: The Act of Termination: The "No Reason" Defense

facets.legalText: The employer failed to provide a valid reason for termination related to the worker's capacity or conduct, or the organizational needs of the undertaking.

group_5.title: The Act of Termination: Constructive Dismissal

facets.legalText: Employee was forced to resign due to the employer's unlawful or abusive actions (e.g., sexual harassment, assault, danger to safety), which constitutes termination by the employer.

reliefs.text: Judgment declaring the termination unlawful pursuant to Art. 43.
Order for reinstatement to previous position with full back pay from the date of termination until reinstatement (Art. 43(1)).
Payment of compensation in lieu of reinstatement, equivalent to 180 times the average daily wage, and an additional 30 days for each year of service (not to exceed 12 months total) (Art. 43(2,3)).
Payment of Severance Pay as per the calculation in Art. 39 & 40 (Only if not reinstated).
Payment of Compensation for lack of proper notice, equivalent to salary for the notice period (Art. 44).
Costs and fees to be covered by the respondent.

labour_unpaid_wages.documentTitle: Statement of Claim for Outstanding Payments

facets.legalText: Non-payment of regular monthly salary for the month(s) of [Specify Months].
An unlawful deduction was made from the salary without employee consent or a valid court order.
Employee worked beyond the standard 8 hours/day or 48 hours/week without receiving overtime compensation at the legally mandated rates.
Employee was not permitted to take annual leave and was not compensated for the accrued, unused leave upon termination of employment.
facets.citation: Art. 77 & 79 (Conversion to cash only upon termination)

facets.legalText: Employee worked on public holidays but was not compensated at a rate of two times their ordinary hourly rate.

reliefs.text: An order for the Respondent to pay the total principal amount of all outstanding wages and benefits.
An order for the payment of statutory interest on the delayed payments as per the relevant provisions of the Civil Code.
A specific order for the payment of calculated overtime wages.
Costs and fees to be covered by the respondent.

facets.legalText: The injury occurred during the performance of the employee's duties within the regular working hours and at the designated workplace.
The injury occurred while the employee was commuting directly between their residence and the workplace, using transport provided by the employer.
The injury occurred outside the regular workplace while the employee was carrying out a specific order given by the employer.
The employee has contracted an occupational disease as a direct result of exposure to hazards in the work environment.
A permanent partial disability has been sustained as a result of the injury, confirmed by a medical board certificate.
A temporary total disability was sustained, rendering the employee unable to work for a specific period.

reliefs.text: An order for the full payment of all medical, surgical, pharmaceutical, and hospital care expenses incurred due to the injury (Art. 105).
Payment of disability compensation, calculated based on the employee's salary and the percentage of disability as determined by the medical board (Art. 109 & 110).
Payment for temporary disability, equivalent to 75% of the employee's daily wage, for the duration of the disability (Art. 106).
Costs and fees to be covered by the respondent.

civil_service_disciplinary_appeal.documentTitle: Memorandum of Appeal to the Administrative Tribunal

facets.legalText: Dismissal from Service.
Downgrading of job position/grade.
Imposition of a fine exceeding one month's salary.
The Institution took the measure without giving the Appellant a chance to present a defense.
The rigorous measure was taken more than 1 year after the offense was known, barring it by limitation.
The simple measure was taken more than 6 months after the offense was known, barring it by limitation.
The Disciplinary Committee was not constituted according to Regulation 77/2002 (e.g., no staff representative).
The alleged act does not constitute a disciplinary offense under the law.
The penalty is disproportionate to the offense committed.
The appellant was already punished for the same alleged offense.

reliefs.text: To quash/annul the administrative decision of the Respondent Institution.
To order the reinstatement of the Appellant to their former position and payment of full salary for the period of suspension (Art. 81(3)).
To order the expunging of the disciplinary measure from the Appellant's personal file.

facets.legalText: Termination for performance was unlawful as the Appellant did not receive two consecutive "unsatisfactory" evaluations.
Termination for performance was unlawful as the Appellant was not provided with necessary training and support to improve.
Termination due to illness was unlawful as it occurred before the Appellant had exhausted all available sick leave (8 months on full pay, 4 months on half pay).
Termination due to illness was unlawful as no Medical Board certificate was produced to declare permanent disability.
Termination due to abolition of position (redundancy) was unlawful as the Appellant was not offered a similar vacant position before termination.

reliefs.text: To quash/annul the administrative decision of termination.
To order the reinstatement of the Appellant to their former position with full back pay.

facets.legalText: A complaint was submitted to the institutional Grievance Handling Committee on [Date], but the decision was unsatisfactory or not rendered in time.
The Appellant was unlawfully denied a promotion despite scoring higher points than the selected candidate, in violation of the merit principle.
The Appellant was unlawfully denied a periodic salary increment despite meeting all performance requirements.
The Appellant served in a higher position in an acting capacity but was unlawfully denied the acting allowance for that period.

reliefs.text: To order the Respondent Institution to grant the promotion due to the Appellant.
To order the payment of the denied salary increment, with retroactive effect.
To order the refund of any unlawfully deducted salary.

family_divorce_dispute.documentTitle: Statement of Claim for Dissolution of Marriage
family_divorce_dispute.jurisdictionText: Art. 11(2) of Federal Courts Proc. 25/96 and Art. 76 of the Revised Family Code.

facets.legalText: The Plaintiff and Defendant were legally married on [Date].
There are irreconcilable differences making the continuation of the marriage impossible.
The parties have lived separately for a period exceeding [Number] months.
The marriage produced [Number] children.

reliefs.text: Judgment dissolving the marriage between the Plaintiff and Defendant.
Order granting sole/joint custody of the minor children to the Plaintiff.
Order for the Defendant to pay monthly child maintenance.
Order for the liquidation and partition of common marital property.

family_divorce_agreement.documentTitle: Petition for Approval of Divorce by Mutual Consent
family_divorce_agreement.jurisdictionText: Art. 77 of the Revised Family Code.

facets.legalText: Both parties have voluntarily agreed to dissolve their marriage.
The parties have prepared a comprehensive agreement regarding the division of property and custody of children.

reliefs.text: Order approving the divorce agreement and dissolving the marriage.

family_paternity_claim.documentTitle: Statement of Claim for Judicial Declaration of Paternity
family_paternity_claim.jurisdictionText: Art. 143 of the Revised Family Code.

facets.legalText: The mother and the Defendant had sexual relations during the legal period of conception.
The Defendant has treated the child as his own in public and private spheres.

reliefs.text: Judgment declaring the Defendant is the biological father of the child.
Order for reimbursement of expenses related to birth and maintenance.

app_temporary_maintenance.documentTitle: Application for Order of Provisional Maintenance
app_temporary_maintenance.jurisdictionText: Art. 83(2) of the Revised Family Code & Art. 154 Civil Procedure Code.

facets.legalText: A main suit for divorce is currently pending between the parties.
The Applicant has no independent income to support themselves/the children during the litigation.
The Respondent has sufficient income to provide provisional support.

reliefs.text: Order the Respondent to pay [Amount] ETB monthly until final judgment.

app_property_preservation.documentTitle: Application for Attachment and Preservation of Common Property
app_property_preservation.jurisdictionText: Art. 154 Civil Procedure Code & Art. 83 Revised Family Code.

facets.legalText: There is a reasonable apprehension that the Respondent is attempting to sell, transfer, or hide common marital assets.
The property in question is common property acquired during the marriage.

reliefs.text: Order restraining the Respondent from transferring or selling specific assets.
Order freezing the joint bank accounts pending final partition.

app_protective_order.jurisdictionText: Art. 154 Civil Procedure Code (Inherent Power) & Criminal Code References.

facets.legalText: The Applicant faces immediate physical danger from the Respondent.
The harm to the Applicant if the order is not granted outweighs any inconvenience to the Respondent.

reliefs.text: Order the Respondent to temporarily vacate the matrimonial home.
Order restraining the Respondent from coming within [Distance] meters of the Applicant.

family_post_judgment_partition.documentTitle: Application for Liquidation and Partition of Common Property
family_post_judgment_partition.jurisdictionText: Art. 85 & 90 of the Revised Family Code and Art. 219 of the Civil Procedure Code (Execution Proceedings).

facets.legalText: This Honorable Court has already rendered a judgment dissolving the marriage between the parties under this file number.
Issues regarding child custody and maintenance have already been adjudicated.
The parties acquired movable and immovable property during the existence of the marriage which constitutes Common Property.
The property is currently in the sole possession/control of the Respondent/Applicant.
The Applicant possesses proof of personal property owned prior to the marriage or acquired by succession/donation, which must be withdrawn before partition.
The parties are unable to agree on the value or mode of partition of the assets.
The complexity of the assets (e.g., business shares, real estate) requires professional valuation.

reliefs.text: Order the appointment of a court-verified expert/liquidator to inventory and value the common property.
Order the restitution/withdrawal of the Applicant's personal property [List Items] prior to partition.
Order the remaining common property be divided equally (50/50) between the parties.
Order the sale by auction of indivisible property and the division of the proceeds.

succession_heirship_declaration.jurisdictionText: Art. 996 of the Civil Code & Civil Procedure Code.

facets.legalText: The Deceased, [Name], passed away on [Date] at [Place].
The Applicants are the children/descendants of the deceased.
The Deceased left no will, necessitating an intestate succession.
Three witnesses are present to testify that the Applicants are the only known heirs.

reliefs.text: Judgment declaring the Applicants as the sole legal heirs of the Deceased.
Order the issuance of a Certificate of Heirship.

facets.legalText: The Deceased left a valid will dated [Date].
The will was read in the presence of four witnesses and the Registrar.
The will is entirely written, dated, and signed by the hand of the deceased.

reliefs.text: Judgment declaring the Will to be valid and the true last wish of the Deceased.
Order confirming the Petitioner as the Executor of the will.

succession_partition_estate.documentTitle: Application for Partition of Hereditary Estate

facets.legalText: The parties have been legally declared as co-heirs.
The debts of the estate have been paid, and the assets are ready for division.
The Co-heirs cannot agree on a voluntary division of the assets.

reliefs.text: Order the physical division of the property in kind among the heirs.
Order the sale of the property and division of proceeds (if division in kind is impossible).

facets.legalText: The estate involves complex debts and multiple assets requiring professional management.
The will did not nominate an executor, or the heirs cannot agree on one.

reliefs.text: Order the appointment of a neutral Liquidator to administer the estate.

app_seal_estate.jurisdictionText: Art. 946 of the Civil Code & Civil Procedure Code.

facets.legalText: There is an imminent risk that movables or documents may be removed or hidden.
There are minor heirs whose interests require protection.

reliefs.text: Order the court registrar to affix official seals on the deceased's property/safe.

ip_trademark_infringement.documentTitle: Statement of Claim for Trademark Infringement and Damages

facets.legalText: The Plaintiff is the registered owner of Trademark No. [Number] for goods/services in Class [Class].
The Defendant is using an identical or confusingly similar mark in the course of trade.
The Defendant's use is likely to cause confusion among the relevant consumers.

reliefs.text: Judgment granting a permanent injunction restraining the Defendant from further use of the infringing mark.
Order payment of damages suffered by the Plaintiff due to the infringement.
Order the destruction of all infringing materials and goods.

ip_patent_infringement.documentTitle: Statement of Claim for Patent Infringement and Compensation

facets.legalText: The Plaintiff holds Patent No. [Number], which is valid and in force.
The Defendant is manufacturing/selling a product that falls within the scope of the patent claims.
The infringement has resulted in direct commercial loss of [Amount] due to lost sales.

reliefs.text: Judgment ordering the Defendant to cease all acts of manufacturing and selling the infringing product.
Order payment of compensation calculated based on a reasonable royalty fee.
Order the seizure and disposal of the machinery primarily used to produce the infringing articles.

ip_copyright_infringement.documentTitle: Statement of Claim for Copyright Violation and Statutory Damages
ip_copyright_infringement.jurisdictionText: Art. 38 of Copyright and Neighboring Rights Proclamation No. 410/2004.

facets.legalText: The Plaintiff is the author of the original work [Title] published/fixed on [Date].
The Defendant has reproduced, distributed, or publicly performed the work without authorization.
The infringement was committed on a commercial scale.

reliefs.text: Order payment of statutory damages as provided by law, or actual damages suffered.
Order a final injunction prohibiting further unauthorized use.
Order the impoundment of all copies of the infringing work.

app_ip_interlocutory_injunction.documentTitle: Application for Interlocutory Injunction to Restrain Infringement
app_ip_interlocutory_injunction.jurisdictionText: Art. 154 of the Civil Procedure Code (General Injunction) and specific IP enabling clauses.

facets.legalText: The Applicant has established a strong prima facie case of infringement.
The continued infringement will cause irreparable harm to the Applicant's market share and reputation.
The balance of convenience favors granting the injunction (i.e., less harm to stop than to continue).

reliefs.text: Order the Respondent to temporarily cease all manufacture, sale, or distribution of the infringing goods pending final judgment.

app_ip_anton_piller.documentTitle: Application for Preservation and Seizure of Evidence
app_ip_anton_piller.jurisdictionText: Art. 154 of the Civil Procedure Code (Inherent Power) & Art. 10 of Proclamation 410/2004.

facets.legalText: There is a serious risk that the Defendant will destroy or conceal crucial evidence of infringement (e.g., molds, accounts).
The Applicant has specific knowledge of the location and nature of the evidence.

reliefs.text: Order a court officer to enter the Respondent's premises to seize and preserve evidence relating to the infringement.

status_judicial_interdiction.documentTitle: Petition for Judicial Interdiction and Appointment of Curator

facets.legalText: The Respondent suffers from a permanent mental illness/disability rendering them unable to manage their own affairs.
The Respondent's incapacity exposes their property/rights to imminent loss or dissipation.
The Petitioner is a close relative of the Respondent and has a legal interest in protecting their affairs.

reliefs.text: Judgment declaring the Respondent to be judicially interdicted.
Order the appointment of the Petitioner (or another suitable person) as Curator to the Respondent.

status_correction_civil_record.documentTitle: Petition for Correction of Civil Record (Birth Date/Name)
status_correction_civil_record.jurisdictionText: Art. 418 of the Civil Procedure Code (Non-Contentious Procedure).

facets.legalText: The Petitioner's [Birth Certificate/ID] contains an error, stating the date of birth is [Incorrect Date] instead of [Correct Date].
The correct information is proven by the attached [Secondary Document].
The relevant administrative body has been requested to correct the error but has failed or refused to do so.

reliefs.text: Judgment ordering the Vital Events Registration Agency (VERA) to correct the record to state the Petitioner's name/date of birth as [Correct Information].

status_declaration_of_absence.documentTitle: Petition for Declaration of Absence and Administration of Property
status_declaration_of_absence.jurisdictionText: Art. 154 and 158 of the Civil Code.

facets.legalText: The named person, [Name], has disappeared and not been heard from for more than five years.
The person's last known domicile was [Address].
A public notice requesting information on the absent person was published in accordance with the law.

reliefs.text: Judgment formally declaring the person to be absent.
Order the appointment of an administrator to provisionally manage the property of the absent person.

app_status_provisional_curator.documentTitle: Application for Appointment of Provisional Curator/Administrator
app_status_provisional_curator.jurisdictionText: Art. 154 of the Civil Procedure Code (Injunction) & Civ. Code Art. 154/343.

facets.legalText: Due to the immediate inability of the person to act, their property is at risk of misuse or loss.
A main petition for Interdiction/Absence has been filed and is currently pending.

reliefs.text: Order the immediate, temporary appointment of a named person to act as Provisional Curator/Administrator.

app_status_lift_interdiction.documentTitle: Petition for Termination of Judicial Interdiction

facets.legalText: The medical/physical condition that necessitated the interdiction has ceased, and the interdicted person has regained capacity.

reliefs.text: Judgment terminating the judicial interdiction and restoring full legal capacity to the individual.

tax_objection_admin_review.documentTitle: Notice of Objection to Tax Assessment
tax_objection_admin_review.jurisdictionText: Art. 54 of the Federal Tax Administration Proclamation (FTAP) No. 983/2016.

facets.legalText: The Tax Assessment Notice was received on [Date].
This Objection is filed within the required 21 days of receipt.
The MoR erred by failing to recognize [Specific Deduction/Exemption].
The assessment was based on an estimate, and the actual gross income is proven by the attached records.

reliefs.text: Order the Ministry of Revenue to revoke the current assessment.
Order the Ministry to re-calculate the tax liability to [Correct Amount].

tax_appeal_ftac.documentTitle: Petition of Appeal to the Federal Tax Appeal Commission
tax_appeal_ftac.jurisdictionText: Art. 88 of the Federal Tax Administration Proclamation (FTAP).

facets.legalText: The MoR issued a decision rejecting the Taxpayer's Objection on [Date].
The Taxpayer has deposited 50% of the disputed tax amount (excluding penalties/interest).
The MoR's internal review decision is erroneous because [Specific Reason, e.g., misapplication of VAT Proclamation 1341/2024].

reliefs.text: Judgment overturning the MoR's decision and adjusting the tax liability.
Order the MoR to undertake a new assessment using correct legal principles.

customs_claim_for_refund.documentTitle: Application to the Customs Commission for Refund of Duty
customs_claim_for_refund.jurisdictionText: Provisions of the Customs Proclamation No. 859/2014 concerning refunds.

facets.legalText: The Applicant paid Customs Duty of [Amount] for goods imported/exported under Declaration No. [SAD No.].
The duty was refundable because [e.g., the goods were defective and re-exported, or the valuation was miscalculated].
The Customs Commission has refused or failed to process the refund application.

reliefs.text: Order the Customs Commission to refund the overpaid duty amount of [Amount].

app_tax_stay_of_execution.documentTitle: Application for Stay of Execution of Tax Payment
app_tax_stay_of_execution.jurisdictionText: Art. 154 of the Civil Procedure Code (Injunction) applied to tax execution.

facets.legalText: The MoR has begun execution procedures (e.g., freezing bank accounts) to collect the disputed tax.
Forcing payment of the full amount now would render the company insolvent, causing irreparable harm to the business.
The Taxpayer has a strong likelihood of success on appeal.

reliefs.text: Order the Ministry of Revenue to suspend the execution of the outstanding tax liability until the final decision of the FTAC/Court.

app_tax_adr_request.documentTitle: Application for Referral to Tax Dispute Alternative Resolution
app_tax_adr_request.jurisdictionText: Tax Administration Proclamations often include provisions allowing for settlement or ADR.

facets.legalText: Both the Taxpayer and the MoR have indicated a willingness to resolve the dispute through mutual agreement.
The dispute involves complex factual issues that would be better resolved through expert negotiation than court litigation.

reliefs.text: Order the establishment of a joint committee or referral to a mediator to reach a binding settlement agreement.

tort_general_negligence_claim.documentTitle: Statement of Claim for Extra-Contractual Damages (Negligence)
tort_general_negligence_claim.jurisdictionText: Arts. 2028-2061 of the Civil Code of 1960 (Liability arising out of fault).

facets.legalText: The Defendant committed a negligent act or omission that violated the general duty of care (Art. 2028).
The fault arose from a specific breach of traffic laws or other legal/regulatory duty of caution.
The Defendant is liable for the act of a minor, apprentice, or employee under their supervision or control (Art. 2085 et seq.).
The Plaintiff sustained bodily injury and incurred expenses for treatment, hospitalization, and rehabilitation.
The Plaintiff's property (e.g., vehicle, structure) was damaged or destroyed, requiring repair or replacement.
The Plaintiff suffered moral damage, including pain and suffering, emotional distress, and loss of amenity.
There is a direct and certain causal link between the Defendant's fault and the damage sustained by the Plaintiff (Art. 2034).
The Plaintiff has taken reasonable steps to mitigate and reduce the extent of the damages sustained.

reliefs.text: To order the Defendant to pay all costs incurred for medical treatment, hospital stay, and rehabilitation, in the amount of Birr [AMOUNT].
To order the Defendant to pay the cost of repairing/replacing the damaged property, in the amount of Birr [AMOUNT].
To order the Defendant to pay compensation for lost earnings and future loss of income due to permanent incapacity, in the amount of Birr [AMOUNT].
To award the Plaintiff compensation for moral damage (pain, suffering, and distress) in the amount of Birr [AMOUNT].

tort_strict_liability_buildings.documentTitle: Statement of Claim for Damages (Strict Liability for Buildings)
tort_strict_liability_buildings.jurisdictionText: Art. 2068 of the Civil Code of 1960 (Liability of the owner of a building).

facets.legalText: The Respondent is the owner of the building or structure from which the damage originated.
The damage was caused by the total or partial ruin of the building, which was due to lack of repair or a defect in construction.
The Plaintiff sustained bodily injury as a direct result of the building's ruin.
The Plaintiff's property was damaged as a direct result of the building's ruin.

reliefs.text: To order the Defendant to pay the cost of repairing the resulting property damage, in the amount of Birr [AMOUNT].
To order the Defendant to pay all costs incurred for bodily injury and treatment, in the amount of Birr [AMOUNT].

admin_appeal_judicial_review.documentTitle: Petition for Judicial Review of Administrative Decision (የአስተዳደር ውሳኔ በፍርድ ቤት እንዲታይ አቤቱታ)
admin_appeal_judicial_review.jurisdictionText: Federal Administrative Procedure Proclamation No. 1183/2020, Art. 51 (የፌደራል የአስተዳደር ሥነ-ሥርዓት አዋጅ ቁጥር ፩ሺ፩፻፹፫/፪ሺ፲፪፣ አንቀጽ ፶፩).

facets.legalText: The Respondent Agency issued a final, binding administrative decision affecting the rights or interests of the Petitioner on [Date]. (መልስ ሰጪው ተቋም የመጨረሻ የአስተዳደር ውሳኔ አሳልፏል።)

The Petitioner has exhausted all available administrative remedies within the Agency, or the Agency failed to render a decision on the complaint within the legal timeframe. (አቤቱታ አቅራቢው በ ተቋሙ ያለውን የውስጥ ቅሬታ የመፍቻ መንገድ ተጠቅሟል ወይም ተቋሙ በጊዜ ውሳኔ መስጠት አልቻለም።)
This petition is filed within the thirty (30) day period prescribed from the date of notification of the decision. (ይህ አቤቱታ ውሳኔው ከደረሰበት ቀን አንስቶ በሰላሳ (፴) ቀን ውስጥ የቀረበ ነው።)

The decision was made without affording the Petitioner an adequate opportunity for a proper hearing (Art. 34) or without considering relevant evidence. (ውሳኔው አቤቱታ አቅራቢው በአግባቡ ሳይሰማ ቀርቷል (አንቀጽ ፴፬) ወይም አግባብነት ያላቸው ማስረጃዎች ሳይታዩ ቀርቷል።)

The decision is based on a fundamental error of law, misinterpreting or misapplying the governing Proclamation, Regulation, or Directive. (ውሳኔው ህጉን በመሳት፣ ወይም አዋጁን፣ ደንቡን ወይም መመሪያውን በተሳሳተ መንገድ በመተርጎም የተሰጠ ነው።)

The Agency failed to provide an adequate and reasoned decision, thus violating the Petitioner's right to a reasoned decision (Art. 37). (ተቋሙ አቤቱታ አቅራቢው ምክንያት ያለው ውሳኔ የማግኘት መብቱን በመጣስ በቂ እና ምክንያት ያለበት ውሳኔ መስጠት ተስኖታል።)

The Agency abused its discretionary power by acting outside the scope of its legal mandate or for an improper purpose (Art. 39). (ተቋሙ ሕጋዊ ሥልጣኑን ያለአግባብ በመጠቀም፣ ወይም ለተገቢ ላልሆነ ዓላማ ውሳኔ በመስጠት የሕግ አቅሙን አላግባብ ተጠቅሟል።)

reliefs.text: To quash and annul the decision of the Respondent Agency. (የመልስ ሰጪውን ተቋም ውሳኔ ሙሉ በሙሉ እንዲሻር።)
To order the Administrative Agency to revise or reconsider its decision by rectifying the shortcomings identified by the Court. (ፍርድ ቤቱ ባገኘው ክፍተት መሰረት ተቋሙ ውሳኔውን እንዲያስተካክል ወይም እንደገና እንዲያየው እንዲታዘዝ።)

To order the Respondent Agency to pay compensation for damages incurred as a result of the fault committed through the administrative decision (Art. 54). (በአስተዳደራዊ ውሳኔው በደረሰው ስህተት ምክንያት ለደረሰበት ጉዳት ካሳ እንዲከፍለው።)

admin_review_directive_legality.documentTitle: Petition for Judicial Review of Legality of a Directive (የአስተዳደር መመሪያ ሕጋዊነት በፍርድ ቤት እንዲታይ አቤቱታ)
admin_review_directive_legality.jurisdictionText: Federal Administrative Procedure Proclamation No. 1183/2020, Art. 49 (የፌደራል የአስተዳደር ሥነ-ሥርዓት አዋጅ ቁጥር ፩ሺ፩፻፹፫/፪ሺ፲፪፣ አንቀጽ ፵፱).

group_1.title: Directive Authority and Compliance (የመመሪያ ስልጣን እና ተገዢነት)

facets.legalText: The Directive was issued without proper delegation of power by law, or it exceeds the scope of the delegating Proclamation. (መመሪያው በሕግ ተገቢው ስልጣን ሳይሰጥ የተሰጠ ነው፣ ወይም ከአዋጁ ወሰን በላይ አልፏል።)
The Directive violates the Constitution or other superior law. (መመሪያው ሕገ-መንግስትን ወይም ሌላ የላቀ ህግን ይጥሳል።)

The Directive was adopted without following the mandatory procedure (e.g., public notice, soliciting comments, or FAG consultation) required by law (Arts. 7-12). (መመሪያው ሲወጣ በህግ የተደነገገው የግዴታ ሂደት (ለምሳሌ የህዝብ አስተያየት መጠየቅ ወይም ጠቅላይ ዓቃቤ ህግን ማማከር) ሳይከተል ቀርቷል (አንቀጽ ፯-፲፪)።)
The Directive directly affects the Petitioner's rights or interests. (መመሪያው የአቤቱታ አቅራቢውን መብት ወይም ጥቅም በቀጥታ ይነካል።)

reliefs.text: To invalidate the Directive in whole or in part. (መመሪያው ሙሉ በሙሉ ወይም በከፊል ውድቅ እንዲደረግለት።)
To order the Agency to rectify the procedural flaw and readopt the Directive in compliance with the law. (ተቋሙ የሥነ-ሥርዓት ጉድለቱን እንዲያስተካክል እና መመሪያውን በሕጉ መሠረት ዳግም እንዲያወጣ ትዕዛዝ እንዲሰጥ።)
